meanings.definition: A place where eggs are hatched under artificial conditions.
meanings.sent1: The hatcheries carefully monitor the temperature to help the eggs hatch.
meanings.sent2: The farmer visited the hatcheries to check on the hatching process.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken bring a tiny umbrella to the hatcheries? To stay dry during the hatching!
meanings.sent4: The hatcheries buzzed with activity as the eggs began to crack open.
meanings.sent5: In the hatcheries, the miracle of life unfolds as eggs transform into chicks.

meanings.definition: A facility where young fish or poultry are hatched and raised for commercial purposes.
meanings.sent1: The hatcheries produce thousands of fish for sale each year.
meanings.sent2: Visitors were amazed by the size of the commercial hatcheries.
meanings.sent3: Why did the fish refuse to play hide and seek at the hatcheries? Because they always got caught!
meanings.sent4: The hatcheries acted as a nursery for the young poultry, providing them with a safe environment to grow.
meanings.sent5: The bustling hatcheries were a testament to the success of the commercial breeding program.
